benchmark_details.name: CoPESD (Co-Pilot of Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection)
benchmark_details.overview: CoPESD is a multi-level surgical motion dataset designed for training large vision-language models as the co-pilot for Endoscopic Submucosal Dissection (ESD). This dataset contains detailed annotations across various levels of surgical motion granularity.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to provide a comprehensive dataset for training LVLMs to support surgical automation and instruction-following during ESD.

data.source: The dataset is constructed from over 35 hours of ESD videos collected using in-vivo porcine models utilizing both robot-assisted and conventional ESD techniques.
data.size: 17,679 images with 32,699 bounding boxes and 88,395 multi-level motions
data.annotation: Annotated by trained medical professionals with a focus on multi-level surgical motion granularity.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of LVLMs in predicting surgical motions and their corresponding bounding boxes against ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores represent better performance in predicting the robotic motions required during surgical procedures.
methodology.validation: The benchmark includes thorough evaluations using state-of-the-art LVLMs on a set of diverse surgical tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No confidential or sensitive data is included in the dataset.
